title.rendered: Riley Minor: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Riley Minor
    • Early Life
    • Professional Career
  • Riley Minor’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Wife
    • How old is he?
    • Height and Wright
    • FAQs About Riley Minor
  • Wrapping Up: Riley Minor’s Net Worth

Riley Minor is a professional rodeo athlete specializing in team roping. He hails from Ellensburg, Washington, and is part of a fourth-generation ranching and rodeo family. He joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) in 2008.

Here we have Riley Minor’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Riley Minor

Riley Minor, a professional rodeo cowboy, has made a significant impact in the world of team roping. He has qualified for the Wrangler NFR 11 times (2008-09, 2011, 2013-19, 2022). Born and raised in the United States, Riley has always been passionate about rodeo, a trait that has been instrumental in shaping his successful career.

Riley is not the only one in his family with a love for rodeo. His brother, Brady Minor, is also a professional rodeo cowboy, and together they have won numerous competitions, including the prestigious RFD-TV’s The American, where they won $100,000 each. The Minor brothers’ success is a testament to their skill, teamwork, and dedication to the sport.

Early Life

Riley Minor’s early life was steeped in the culture of rodeo. Growing up, he was inspired by the thrill and challenge of the sport, which eventually led him to pursue a career as a professional rodeo cowboy. His passion for rodeo was nurtured by his family, particularly his brother Brady, who also embarked on a career in the sport.

Professional Career

Riley Minor, a professional rodeo contestant from Ellensburg, Washington, has had a notable career in team roping, primarily with his brother Brady Minor.

He has qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (WNFR) 11 times. Throughout his career, Riley has had several significant wins. In 2023, he won The Last Stand Rodeo (Coulee City, Wash.), the Central Point (Ore.), Wild Rogue ProRodeo, and the Magic Valley Stampede (Filer, Idaho). He has also competed at RODEOHOUSTON multiple times, with his biggest rodeo win being The American.

He also had a notable win at the 2021 Ariat World Series of Team Roping Finale in Vegas, where he and Cory Petska won $77,000. In 2017, Riley and Brady Minor won $100,000 each at RFD-TV’s The American.

Riley Minor’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Riley Minor’s net worth is estimated to be $3 million. His earnings from various rodeo competitions, endorsements, and other sources contribute to his overall wealth.

Career Earnings

Riley Minor is a professional rodeo contestant who has had a successful career in the sport. As of 2023, his career earnings total $1,906,919. 

In the 2022 world standings, he was placed 11th. During the 2022 Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR), he secured third place and earned $66,895.

Endorsements

Riley is endorsed by several companies in the rodeo industry. Two of these companies are Equibrand and Cactus Ropes.

Equibrand is a company that represents Classic and Rattler, two brands known in the rodeo industry. The company has a long history of endorsing professional ropers, and their endorsement deals often include providing free ropes and other benefits to their endorsees.

Personal Details

Wife

Riley Minor is married to Jordan Crossley Minor. Jordan is also a talented competitor in the sport of barrel racing. The couple has two daughters, Monroe and McCoy.

How old is he?

Riley Minor, the professional rodeo contestant, is 35 years old as of 2023.

Height and Wright


He stands at 5 ft 10 inches tall and weighs 170 lbs.

FAQs About Riley Minor

What is Riley Minor’s Net Worth?

His estimated net worth is $3 million as of 2023.

Who is his brother?

Riley Minor’s brother, Brady Minor, is also a professional rodeo cowboy.

Who is his wife?

Jordan Crossley Minor.

Wrapping Up: Riley Minor’s Net Worth

Riley Minor’s journey in the world of professional rodeo is a testament to his passion, skill, and dedication to the sport. Alongside his brother Brady, he has carved out a successful career in team roping, earning accolades and admiration from fans and peers alike.

Riley has accumulated a net worth of $3 million. As he continues to compete and inspire, Riley Minor’s story serves as a shining example of the spirit of rodeo.
